Package Game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game.Board.Board
      • Game.Game
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Client, DummyBot, RealPlayer
    public class Game
extends Board
    Starts the actual game with two players. Creates a new 6x6 board, filled with 4 3x3 squares The board is initially filled with Spot.EMPTY Contains methods that control the entire game flow of the system.

    • Method Detail

      • determineWhoStarts

        public boolean determineWhoStarts()
        Determines who will start the game with Spot.WHITE.
        Returns:
        random 0 or 1

      • setPlayerRandomly

        public void setPlayerRandomly​(Player firstPlayer,
                              Player secondPlayer)
        Method that randomly determines if player1 starts or player2 starts. Appends both players to players hashmap that contains names of the players, and their colors
        Parameters:
        firstPlayer - player that is to be matched with certain Spot
        secondPlayer - player that is to be matched with the other Spot as player1
        Requires
        player1 != null && player1 instanceof Player, player2 != null && player2 instanceof Player

      • setPlayer

        public void setPlayer​(Player firstPlayer,
                      Player secondPlayer)
        Method that assigns colors to the given players, in the order the names are provided (used for client).
        Parameters:
        firstPlayer - player that is to be matched with WHITE Spot
        secondPlayer - player that is to be matched with the BLACK Spot
        Requires
        player1 != null && player1 instanceof Player, player2 != null && player2 instanceof Player

      • setMove

        public void setMove​(int firstInput,
                    int secondInput)
        Method that translates server syntax, into local game syntax using class Utilities.
        Parameters:
        firstInput - value between 0 and 35. Associated with x,y coordinates
        secondInput - value between 0 and 7. Associated with square number and it's rotation

      • getMove

        public Move getMove()
        Method for returning the current move in the game (used by the client).
        Returns:
        this.currentMove

      • addPlayer

        public void addPlayer​(Player player,
                      Spot spot)
        Adds player to the hashmap where Player name, Spot color pairs are stored.
        Parameters:
        player - player to be set in the hashmap
        spot - spot to be set in the hashmap
        Requires
        player != null, spot != null, player instanceof RealPlayer || player instanceof DummyBot, spot.equals(Spot.WHITE) || spot.equals(Spot.BLACK)

      • switchPlayerTurn

        public void switchPlayerTurn​(Player firstPlayer,
                             Player secondPlayer)
        Switches the turn of the player. If player1 made a move, then player2 will get the turn and vice versa
        Parameters:
        firstPlayer - player that is to be matched with certain Spot
        secondPlayer - player that is to be matched with the other Spot as player1
        Requires
        player1 != null && player1 instanceof Player, player2 != null && player2 instanceof Player

      • bot

        public void bot()
        Entire code for the game between a real players and a DummyBot. Code is very extensive, robust and poorly optimized. Creates an offline game between the RealPlayer and a DummyBot

      • realPlayer

        public void realPlayer()
        Entire code for the game between two real players. Code is very extensive, robust and poorly optimized. Creates an offline game two instances of RealPlayer

      • clientSetup

        public boolean clientSetup()
        Method that initializes the connection with the server. Checks if the input contains proper syntax, and if values are valid Finishes only if there is a connection established between the client and a server Input is to be: IPaddress port If input is only 999, the connection sequence is terminated
        Returns:
        true if client setup has finished successfully, false if there were issues on the way

      • getGame

        public Game getGame()

      • realClientPlayer

        public void realClientPlayer()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Entire code for the game between a RealPlayer and another client. Code is very extensive, robust and poorly optimized. Creates an offline game two instances of RealPlayer
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the BufferedReader within is suddenly closed.

      • botClientPlayer

        public void botClientPlayer()
        Entire code for the game between a DummyBot client and another client. Code is very extensive, robust and poorly optimized. Creates an offline game two instances of RealPlayer

      • play

        public void play()
        Switch cases that is used in the main menu, and allows the user to navigate through different game scenarios.

      • printBoard

        public java.lang.String printBoard()
        Returns the current state of the game in textual representation from the superclass Board.
        Returns:
        message
        Ensures
        message != null

      • printFreeCoordinates

        public void printFreeCoordinates​(Game currentGame)
        Prints out three random free coordinates on the current board, in a user-friendly way.
        Parameters:
        currentGame - current game
